prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 2. Create a 2D sketch on a new plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw a rectangle by creating four linear curves: - Line 1: Starting at (0, 0), ending at (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0), ending at (0.75, 0.75) - Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.75), ending at (0, 0.75) - Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.75), ending at (0, 0) 4. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 6. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal vector by 0.0703 units. 7. Perform a 'New Body Features' boolean operation to generate the final part. Part 2: Reduced Rectangular Prism Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following translation vector relative to the first part's coordinate system: (0.0234, 0.0234, 0.0703) 2. Create a 2D sketch on a new plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw a rectangle by creating four linear curves, similar to part 1 but scaled by 0.7031: - Line 1: Starting at (0, 0), ending at (0.7031, 0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.7031, 0), ending at (0.7031, 0.7031) - Line 3: Starting at (0.7031, 0.7031), ending at (0, 0.7031) - Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.7031), ending at (0, 0) 4. Close the loop and complete the sketch. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's parameters: - Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 6. Extrude the 3D sketch along the opposite normal vector by 0.0234 units. 7. Perform a 'Cut Feature' boolean operation to generate the final part. Part 3: Illuminated Reflective Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a reflective surface. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and its sides are parallel to each other. The reflective surface is centered on the front face of the prism. The prism is illuminated from the front, creating a bright reflection on the surface. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following translation vector relative to the second part's coordinate system: (0.0938, 0.0938, 0.0469) 2. Create a 2D sketch on a new plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw a rectangle by creating four linear curves, scaled by 0.5625: - Line 1: Starting at (0, 0), ending at (0.5625, 0) - Line 2: Starting at (0.5625, 0), ending at (0.5625, 0.5625) - Line 3: Starting at (0.5625, 0.5625), ending at (0, 0.5625) - Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.</description>
